items.title: Why the shake-up of school inspections risks causing new problems
items.summary: Ofsted's new 'traffic light' rating system comes into force this week - does this mark meaningful change or, as one expert puts it, 'high level tinkering'?

items.title: Why Scotland's teachers want 90 minutes back
items.summary: Scotland's teachers are preparing to vote on industrial action over workload and time spent in front of pupils.

items.title: NI schools could be named and shamed over unaffordable uniforms
items.summary: New uniform guidance to schools has been issued from the Department of Education.

items.title: Nursery pays out £10,000 after toddler breaks leg on first day
items.summary: Skye Tucker fell from a nappy changing table at Little Clouds Nursery in Altens, Aberdeen, in January this year.

items.title: Fresh strike action begins at city university
items.summary: Union members at Sheffield Hallam Uni strike in a dispute over job losses, workload and welfare.

items.title: No special school places and kids are 'overlooked'
items.summary: The council says the county's special schools are full to capacity.

items.title: University staff to work to rule in job cuts row
items.summary: The university is looking to save £30m amid rising costs and a fall in international student numbers.

items.title: What is Ofsted and how will the new school ratings work?
items.summary: The system is changing after the death of head Ruth Perry highlighted the pressure of inspections.

items.title: Tutoring a baby to make him an 'English gentleman' - Is it worth the money?
items.summary: The advert seeks "an extraordinary tutor" required "to support child on his first steps to becoming an English gentleman."

items.title: Can teacher shortages be solved by attracting career changers?
items.summary: The North East has seen the biggest fall in trainee teachers in England, down by 56% since 2019-20.

items.title: Not having the time of your life at uni? You're not alone
items.summary: Many freshers come with high expectations of what they imagine will be the best years of their lives.

items.title: Being autistic should not mean having to fight for our education
items.summary: The Institute for Public Policy Research says there should be more comprehensive support for Send students in mainstream schools.

items.title: Will my uni fees rise next year? What is a V-level? Your questions answered
items.summary: The DfE has announced it will raise tuition fees every year, and will bring in new V-levels after GCSEs.

items.title: What does university cost, and is it worth it?
items.summary: With rising tuition fees and living costs, do higher graduate earnings cover the cost of a degree?

items.title: How working parents can get 30 hours of free childcare
items.summary: Free childcare support for working parents varies across the UK, depending on the child's age.
